description: information about works of classical literature

command.prompt:
Generate 2 rows for a table of information about works of classical literature. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Characters;Locations;Author;Title;Year;Rating;Style;Genre;Poem;Element;Length;Theme

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Author;Title
Austen;Pride and Prejudice
Dickens;Great Expectations
Garcia-Marquez;One Hundred Years of Solitude
Hardy;Tess of the d'Urbervilles
Herrick;To the Virgins
Homer;The Iliad
Joyce;Ulysses
Plath;Ariel
Shakespeare;As You Like It
Shelley;Ozymandias
Vonnegut;Slaughterhouse-Five

Output the rows in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Characters;Locations;Author;Title;Year;Rating;Style;Genre;Poem;Element;Length;Theme
Characters: Dante Alighieri, Virgil;Locations: Hell, Purgatory, Heaven;Author: Dante Alighieri;Title: The Divine Comedy;Year: 1320;Rating: 5/5;Style: Poetic Narrative;Genre: Italian Literature, Poetry, Fantasy;Poem: Yes;Element: Fire;Length: Long;Theme: Morality, Spirituality, Journey
command.prologue: Characters: Telemachus, Penelope, Odysseus; Locations: Ithaca, Mediterranean; Author: Homer; Title: The Odyssey; Year: 800 BC; Rating: 5/5; Style: Epic Poetry; Genre: Greek Literature, Fantasy, Adventure; Poem: Yes; Element: Water; Length: Long; Theme: Return, Heroism, Cunning
command.epilogue: The data for the second row is sourced from 'The Divine Comedy', an epic poem by Dante Alighieri, an Italian poet from the Middle Ages. The narrative follows Dante as he travels through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, guided by the Roman poet Virgil.
